security_audit.summary: Pure markdown documentation skill containing instructional content and code examples for performance optimization. Contains no executable scripts, no file access operations, no network calls, and no system modifications. All 43 static findings are false positives: markdown backticks were confused for shell execution, metadata fields were flagged as C2 keywords, and legitimate documentation URLs were flagged as hardcoded URLs.

content.value_statement: Applications often suffer from slow load times and poor responsiveness. This skill provides a systematic approach to measure, identify, and fix performance bottlenecks across frontend, backend, and database layers.
actual_capabilities: Guide baseline performance measurement using profilers and benchmarking tools
Identify bottlenecks across CPU, memory, I/O, and database layers
Apply frontend optimizations including bundle splitting and memoization
Optimize backend performance with database query improvements and caching strategies
Validate optimizations by comparing before and after metrics
limitations: Does not execute profiling tools directly - provides guidance for AI to use tools
Does not modify your codebase - recommends changes for you to apply
Does not access external monitoring services or APM tools

use_cases.title: Improve web vitals
use_cases.description: Reduce bundle size and improve React rendering performance for faster page loads

use_cases.title: Speed up API responses
use_cases.description: Identify slow database queries and implement caching to reduce latency

use_cases.title: Profile entire stack
use_cases.description: Diagnose end-to-end performance issues from browser to database

prompt_templates.title: Quick check
prompt_templates.prompt: My application is slow. Help me profile and identify the bottlenecks.

prompt_templates.title: Frontend focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Our website has poor Core Web Vitals. Help us optimize LCP and CLS scores.

prompt_templates.title: Database focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Our database queries are taking too long. Help us identify and fix slow queries.

prompt_templates.title: Complete optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Do a complete performance audit of our application and create an optimization plan.

output_examples.input: Our React app has slow rendering. Help us profile and fix it.
output: Step 1: Profile using React DevTools Profiler or Chrome DevTools
Step 3: Apply memoization with React.memo and useMemo
Step 4: Implement code splitting with lazy loading for heavy components
Step 5: Verify improvements with before/after comparison

output_examples.input: Our database queries are timing out under load.
output: Step 1: Enable slow query logging to identify problematic queries
Step 2: Use EXPLAIN to analyze query execution plans
Step 3: Look for missing indexes or N+1 query patterns
Step 4: Add database caching with Redis for frequently accessed data
Step 5: Implement query result pagination for large datasets

best_practices: Always measure baseline performance before making any changes
Use the right profiling tool for each layer (CPU, memory, I/O, network)
Set specific performance targets based on industry benchmarks like Web Vitals
anti_patterns: Optimizing without data - making changes based on guesses rather than profiling
Focusing only on one layer while ignoring bottlenecks elsewhere
Applying optimizations without measuring to verify actual improvement

faq.question: What tools does this skill use for profiling?
faq.answer: It guides you to use built-in profilers like Node.js --prof, Python cProfile, Chrome DevTools, and Lighthouse.

faq.question: What are good performance targets for APIs?
faq.answer: Target P50 latency under 100ms, P95 under 500ms, and P99 under 1 second with error rates below 0.1%.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with APM tools like New Relic?
faq.answer: This skill provides general guidance. For specific APM integration, ask about your particular tool.

faq.question: Does this skill modify my production code?
faq.answer: No. It provides recommendations and code examples. You apply changes to your codebase.

faq.question: What if my performance targets are not met?
faq.answer: Return to Step 2 and continue identifying bottlenecks. Performance optimization is iterative.

faq.question: How is this different from a linter or build tool?
faq.answer: This skill provides strategic guidance for finding and fixing bottlenecks. Linters and build tools automate specific checks.
